name: 2,2'-[(2-Nitrophenyl)methylene]bis(5-methylfuran)
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2832
Reason: 2,2'-[(2-Nitrophenyl)methylene]bis(5-methylfuran) has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is furan, which has a melting point of -32.0 degrees Celsius. The nitro group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at around -5 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group introduces additional rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The nitro group also introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius.
